descriptions.coatings: Monocoat mortar is ideal for facade coatings, offering protection and decoration in a single application. Its high resistance to weather conditions and wide variety of finishes make it a versatile and durable option. On the other hand, lime mortar is especially useful in traditional buildings or restorations, as it allows for better wall breathability. Both types of mortar provide excellent adhesion and improve the building's aesthetics while keeping the surface well protected.
descriptions.plasters: For plasters and renders, lime mortar is a traditional option that offers great breathability and flexibility, ideal for preventing cracks in old surfaces. In modern applications, monocoat mortar stands out for its dual function of leveling and providing a decorative finish in a single layer, saving time and costs. Both types of mortar ensure good adhesion and resistance to weather conditions, improving the appearance and protection of facades.
descriptions.masonry: The multipurpose joint mortar is ideal for masonry work, as it allows filling joints between bricks or blocks, ensuring a solid and resistant fixation. For exterior coatings, monocoat mortar remains a preferred option due to its ability to protect and decorate structures. For traditional works, lime mortar provides flexibility and moisture resistance, being an excellent alternative in restorations.
descriptions.tiles: Tile adhesive is the most suitable for installing tiles on walls and floors, both indoors and outdoors. It offers high adhesion and resistance, even in extreme humidity or temperature conditions. If a decorative exterior finish is desired, monocoat mortar can also serve as a base for tile placement, providing a well-leveled and resistant surface. This combination ensures an aesthetic and functional solution for ceramic coatings.
descriptions.screeds: Lime mortar is ideal for screeds on floors or facades of traditional buildings, as its flexibility prevents cracks and allows proper breathability. In modern applications, monocoat mortar can be applied over screeds to achieve an aesthetic and resistant finish. This combination ensures a solid and well-protected base, improving the durability and aesthetics of treated surfaces.
descriptions.thermal: For thermal insulation work, monocoat mortar is an efficient solution when applied over external thermal insulation systems (ETICS), offering a protective and decorative layer. If a more natural and breathable solution is desired, lime mortar is an excellent option, as it allows humidity regulation and improves the building's thermal comfort. Both types of mortar contribute to energy efficiency and facade protection.
descriptions.waterproofing: Monocoat mortar is an excellent option for waterproofing facades, as it forms a protective barrier that prevents water entry. For specific applications, such as surfaces with visible joints, multipurpose joint mortar ensures effective sealing. In traditional works, lime mortar also offers waterproofing properties, allowing proper wall breathability. All these mortars help keep structures free from moisture and in good condition.
descriptions.dehumidification: In dehumidification projects, lime mortar is highly recommended for its ability to repel water and allow wall breathability. This characteristic makes it an ideal solution for restorations or constructions with humidity problems. Monocoat mortar also helps keep surfaces dry thanks to its waterproofing and decorative capacity, being a versatile and resistant option to improve facade durability and protect them against moisture accumulation.

descriptions.hammered: The hammered or scraped finish in mortars features a rough, uniform texture achieved by surface scraping before hardening. This construction solution is ideal for facades and exterior walls as it provides excellent wear and weather resistance. The textured appearance hides imperfections while adding rustic elegance, perfect for projects seeking artisanal robustness.
descriptions.washed: The washed or troweled finish is achieved by smoothing the mortar surface to create a uniform texture. Ideal for facades, interior walls and floors, it offers a clean, modern look. This finish ensures good adhesion for paints or additional coatings, with water-repellent properties that prevent cracking for long-lasting durability.
descriptions.printed: Printed mortar can replicate stone, wood, cobblestone or decorative patterns before hardening. Widely used for exterior floors, patios and walkways due to its traffic and weather resistance. Customizable colors and patterns make it ideal for architectural projects combining aesthetics, functionality and durability.
descriptions.stone: Projected stone finish incorporates natural stone particles onto fresh mortar through controlled projection. Perfect for facades and exterior walls, it offers exceptional wear and weather resistance. The timeless rustic elegance enhances architectural designs with durable, low-maintenance appeal.
descriptions.smooth: The smooth finish creates a uniform, texture-free surface through complete leveling. Ideal for modern interiors and minimalist facades, it's compatible with paints and additional coatings for decorative versatility. Provides excellent moisture protection and an attractive construction solution.
